data.chText: 目睹者
data.enText: person who sees sth
eyewitness

data.chText: 目击者；见证人
data.enText: a person who sees sth happen and is able to describe it to other people

data.chText: 警方呼吁这起事故的目击者出来作证。
data.enText: Police have appealed for witnesses to the accident.

data.chText: 杀人案的目击证人
data.enText: a witness to the killing

data.chText: 法庭上
data.enText: in court

data.chText: 证人
data.enText: a person who gives evidence in court

data.chText: 被告的 / 控方的证人
data.enText: a defence/prosecution witness

data.chText: 出庭为被告 / 控方作证
data.enText: to appear as (a) witness for the defence/prosecution

data.chText: 签名
data.enText: of signature

data.chText: 见证人；连署人
data.enText: a person who is present when an official document is signed and who also signs it to prove that they saw this happen

data.chText: 他是我们婚礼的证婚人之一。
data.enText: He was one of the witnesses at our wedding.

data.chText: 宗教信仰
data.enText: of religious beliefs

data.chText: 见证（以言行证实信仰）
data.enText: evidence of a person's strong religious beliefs, that they show by what they say and do in public
be (a) witness to sth

data.chText: 目击，看见（某事发生）
data.enText: to see sth take place

data.chText: 他目击了一起残忍的凶杀事件。
data.enText: He has been witness to a terrible murder.

data.chText: 证明…真实；为…提供证据
data.enText: to show that sth is true; to provide evidence for sth

data.chText: 他身体健康证明这种疗法是成功的。
data.enText: His good health is a witness to the success of the treatment.
bear/give witness (to sth)

data.chText: 为…作证；证明
data.enText: to provide evidence of the truth of sth

data.chText: 看到
data.enText: see sth

data.chText: 当场看到，目击（尤指罪行或事故）
data.enText: to see sth happen (typically a crime or an accident)

data.chText: 她被亲眼目睹的暴虐场面惊呆了。
data.enText: She was shocked by the violent scenes she had witnessed.

data.chText: 警方呼吁凡是目击这一事件的人与他们联系。
data.enText: Police have appealed for anyone who witnessed the incident to contact them.

data.chText: 我们现在看到暴力犯罪空前增多。
data.enText: We are now witnessing an unprecedented increase in violent crime.

data.chText: 时间；地点
data.enText: of time/place

data.chText: 是发生…的地点（或时间、组织等）；见证
data.enText: to be the place, period, organization, etc. in which particular events take place

data.chText: 近年来人们的社会流动性越来越大。
data.enText: Recent years have witnessed a growing social mobility.

data.chText: 零售业的销售额在急剧下降。
data.enText: The retail trade is witnessing a sharp fall in sales.

data.chText: 签署
data.enText: signature

data.chText: （为正式文件的签署）作证，连署
data.enText: to be present when an official document is signed and sign it yourself to prove that you saw this happen

data.chText: 为签字作连署
data.enText: to witness a signature

data.chText: 迹象；证据
data.enText: be sign/proof

data.chText: 是…的迹象；为…的证据
data.enText: to be a sign or proof of sth

data.chText: 从两部新传记的出版可以看出，人们对她的生活和工作越来越感兴趣。
data.enText: There has been increasing interest in her life and work, as witnessed by the publication of two new biographies.

data.chText: 从展览会参观人数之巨大可以看出，人们对现代艺术具有浓厚兴趣。
data.enText: The huge attendance figures for the exhibition witness to a healthy interest in modern art.

data.chText: （摆证据）就是证据，看…就知道
data.enText: used when giving an example that proves sth you have just said

data.chText: 正宗的意大利烹饪对健康非常有益，在意大利心脏病发病率低就是证据。
data.enText: Authentic Italian cooking is very healthy─witness the low incidence of heart disease in Italy.

data.chText: 宗教信仰
data.enText: to religious beliefs

data.chText: （为宗教信仰）做见证
data.enText: to speak to people about your strong religious beliefs

data.text: notice ♦ note ♦ detect ♦ observe ♦ witness ♦ perceive

data.chText: 以上各词均含看到、注意到之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to see sth, especially when you pay careful attention to it.
notice

data.chText: 指看（或听）到、注意到、意识到、注意、留意：
data.enText: to see, hear or become aware of sb/sth; to pay attention to sb/sth

data.chText: 我首先注意到的是这屋子里的气味。
data.enText: The first thing I noticed about the room was the smell.
note

data.chText: 指注意、留意：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to notice or pay careful attention to sth

data.chText: 请注意办事处星期一将关闭。
data.enText: Please note (that) the office will be closed on Monday.

data.chText: 该词在商务英语中非常通用：
data.enText: This word is very common in business English.

data.chText: 注意这些价格含增值税。
data.enText: Note that the prices are inclusive of VAT.
detect

data.chText: 指发现、查明、侦察出：
data.enText: to discover or notice sth, especially sth that is not easy to see, hear, etc.

data.chText: 这些检查旨在早期查出疾病。
data.enText: The tests are designed to detect the disease early.
observe

data.chText: 指看到、注意到、观察到：
data.enText: ( formal ) to see or notice sb/sth

data.chText: 最近你注意到什么变化没有？
data.enText: Have you observed any changes lately?

data.chText: 警察注意到一个男人走进了银行。
data.enText: The police observed a man enter the bank.
witness

data.chText: 指当场看到、目击：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to see sth happen

data.chText: 警方呼吁目击这一事件的人与他们联系。
data.enText: Police have appealed for anyone who witnessed the incident to contact them.
perceive

data.chText: 指注意到、意识到、察觉到：
data.enText: ( formal ) to notice or become aware of sth, especially sth that is not obvious

data.chText: 我注意到他的举止在那几个月里有些改变。
data.enText: I perceived a change in his behaviour over those months.
to notice/note/detect/observe/perceive that/how/what/where/who…
to notice/observe/witness sth happen/sb do sth
to barely/hardly/scarcely notice/detect/observe
to be commonly/frequently noticed/noted/observed
to be worth noticing/noting/observing
sb can't/couldn't help noticing/noting/observing

data.text: witness ♦ audience ♦ viewer ♦ observer ♦ spectator ♦ onlooker ♦ passer-by ♦ bystander ♦ eyewitness

data.chText: 以上各词均指目睹事情发生的人。
data.enText: These are all words for a person who sees sth happen.
witness

data.chText: 指目击者、见证人、证人：
data.enText: a person who sees sth happen and is able to describe it to other people; a person who gives evidence in a court of law

data.chText: 警方呼吁这起事故的目击者出来作证。
data.enText: Police have appealed for witnesses to the accident.
audience

data.chText: 指戏剧、音乐会、电视、电台、电影等的观众或听众
data.enText: a group of people who have gathered to watch or listen to sth such as a play or concert; the number of people who watch or listen to the same thing on television, the radio or in the cinema
viewer

data.chText: 指电视观众、观看者：
data.enText: a person watching television; a person who looks at sth

data.chText: 这个节目吸引了数百万电视观众。
data.enText: The programme attracted millions of viewers.

data.chText: 她的一些艺术作品旨在教观赏者吃惊。
data.enText: Some of her art is intended to shock the viewer.
observer

data.chText: 指观察者、目击者：
data.enText: a person who sees sth happen

data.chText: 据目击者说，飞机起飞后不久就爆炸了。
data.enText: According to observers, the plane exploded shortly after take-off.
spectator

data.chText: 指观看者、观众，尤指体育比赛的：
data.enText: a person who is watching an event, especially a sports event

data.chText: 该体育场可容纳7.5万名观众。
data.enText: The stadium holds 75 000 spectators.
onlooker

data.chText: 指旁观者：
data.enText: a person who watches sth that is happening but is not involved in it

data.chText: 在撞车地点聚集了一大群围观者。
data.enText: A crowd of onlookers gathered at the scene of the crash.
passer-by

data.chText: 路人、过路的人，尤指意想不到的事发生时碰巧路过的：
data.enText: a person who is going past sb/sth by chance, especially when sth unexpected happens

data.chText: 警察询问过路的人是否目击了这次事故。
data.enText: Police asked passers-by if they had witnessed the accident.
bystander

data.chText: 指现场目击者、旁观者：
data.enText: a person who is near and can see what is happening when sth such as an accident or fight takes place

data.chText: 三个无辜的旁观者在交叉火力中丧生。
data.enText: Three innocent bystanders were killed in the crossfire.
eyewitness

data.chText: 指犯罪或事故现场的目击者、见证人
data.enText: a person who has seen a crime or accident and can describe it afterwards
before/in front of a(n) witness/audience/spectator/onlooker/passer-by/bystander/eyewitness
a television/TV audience/viewer
a cinema audience/viewer
to attract/draw/pull in (an) audience/viewers/spectators
a(n) audience/viewer/observer/spectator/onlooker/passer-by/bystander witnesses sth

means: 当场看到，目击(尤指罪行或事故)
是发生…的地点(或时间、组织等)
(为正式文件的签署)作证，连署

ex.chText: 最近的这次晋升进一步证明了吉姆的工作干得有多出色。
ex.enText: The latest promotion was further proof of how good at his job Jim was.

ex.chText: 没有证据证明这个男人偷了你的钱包。
ex.enText: There is no proof that this man stole your purse.

synonyms.bx: 指可以表明某事物真实性的信息、文件等。

ex.chText: 我们有表明火星上存在生命的证据吗？
ex.enText: Do we have evidence of life on Mars?

ex.chText: 有证据表明他的新教学法很管用。
ex.enText: There is evidence that his new teaching method works.

ex.chText: 这些信件可以在庭审时用作证据。
ex.enText: These letters may be used as evidence at the trial.

synonyms.bx: 指表明某事物存在或真实的事实、迹象等，也指法庭上证明某人有罪或无罪的证据。

ex.chText: 这些成就是你勤奋努力的证明。
ex.enText: These achievements are a testimony to your diligence.

ex.chText: 那名小贩的证词对控方的起诉起着关键作用。
ex.enText: That vendor's testimony is crucial to the prosecution's case.

synonyms.bx: 指清楚表明某事物存在或属实的事实或情况，也指法庭上的证词。

ex.enText: The defense has to find the key witness.
The prosecution witness didn't appear in court.

ex.chText: 那座纪念碑屹立在那里，作为对这一事件的见证。
ex.enText: The monument stands there in witness of the event.

synonyms.bx: 多指知道案件情况并在法庭上对其进行陈述的人，也可指证据或证言。

data.enText: be (a) witness to sth

data.chText: 目击，看见（某事发生）
data.enText: to see sth take place

data.chText: 他目击了一起残忍的凶杀事件。
data.enText: He has been witness to a terrible murder.

data.chText: 证明…真实；为…提供证据
data.enText: to show that sth is true; to provide evidence for sth

data.chText: 他身体健康证明这种疗法是成功的。
data.enText: His good health is a witness to the success of the treatment.
bear/give witness (to sth)

data.chText: 为…作证；证明
data.enText: to provide evidence of the truth of sth

tr: testimony by word or deed to your religious faith
someone who looks at something (such as an exhibition of some kind)
example: sky watchers discovered a new star

tr: someone who sees an event and reports what happened
(law) a person who attests to the genuineness of a document or signature by adding their own signature
(law) a person who testifies under oath in a court of law

example: She witnessed the accident and had to testify in court
We found Republicans winning the offices
You'll see a lot of cheating in this school
The 1960's saw the rebellion of the younger generation against established traditions

value.def: A witness to an event such as an accident or crime is a person who saw it.

example.ex: Witnesses to the crash say they saw an explosion just before the disaster...
example.tran: 空难目击者称，就在灾难发生之前他们看见飞机发生了爆炸。

value.def: If you witness something, you see it happen.

example.ex: Anyone who witnessed the attack should call the police...
example.tran: 目睹这次袭击的人都应向警方报告。

example.ex: It was the quickest swimming lesson I'd ever witnessed.
example.tran: 这是我所见过的最速成的游泳课。

value.def: A witness is someone who appears in a court of law to say what they know about a crime or other event.

example.ex: In the next three or four days, eleven witnesses will be called to testify.
example.tran: 接下来的三四天里，将传唤11名证人出庭作证。

value.def: A witness is someone who writes their name on a document that you have signed, to confirm that it really is your signature.
If someone witnesses your signature on a document, they write their name after it, to confirm that it really is your signature.

example.ex: Ask a friend to witness your signature.
example.tran: 请一位朋友给你的签名作证。

value.tran: 为(文件的签署)作证;连署

value.def: If you say that a place, period of time, or person witnessed a particular event or change, you mean that it happened in that place, during that period of time, or while that person was alive.

example.ex: India has witnessed many political changes in recent years...
example.tran: 印度近年来经历了很多政治变动。

example.ex: The year 1886 witnessed the first extended translation into English of the writings of Eliphas Levi...
example.tran: 1886年，埃利法斯·莱维的作品第一次有了长篇英译本。

example.ex: At present, we are witnessing another building boom.
example.tran: 当前，我们又一次处于建筑繁荣期。

value.def: You use witness to introduce an example of what you have just been talking about.

example.ex: Americans are a generous people: witness the increase in charitable giving, even during the recession.
example.tran: 美国人是个慷慨的民族：即使是在经济萧条时期，慈善捐赠也在不断增加，这便是明证。

value.def: If you are witness to something, you see it happen.

example.ex: Too often children are witness to a disturbing amount of violence.
example.tran: 孩子们经常会目睹暴力事件,其数量之多令人不安。

value.tran: 是…的见证人;是…的目击者

value.def: If a person or thing bears witness to something, they show or say that it exists or happened.

example.ex: Many of these poems bear witness to his years spent in India and China...
example.tran: 这些诗中有很多见证了他在印度和中国度过的岁月。

example.ex: Many veterans believe it is their job to bear witness to the horrors of war that they personally experienced.
example.tran: 很多老兵认为他们有职责为他们亲身经历的战争的恐怖作证。

trans: 全民目擊；全民目击；沉默的证人；无声的证言；无声的见证
战栗追杀；无声言证；颤栗追凶；无声言证/战栗追杀；目击者
目击者；亲眼见证人；证人；目击证人
目击者；亲眼见证人；证人；目击证人
同 witness box；(法庭上的)证人席
